title: Bug 41039 - Hitting the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog doesn't do anything on Mac OS X
description: Bug 41039 - Hitting the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog doesn't do anything on Mac OS X
OB: When using Eclipse 3.0 M2Build with Build ID 200307181617 on Mac OS X 10.2.6, the following issue occurs: 1) Open the Find/Replace dialog by navigating to Edit -> Find/Replace. 2) Type a search term into the text box. 3) Press the Return key. However, nothing happens when you press the Return key. The expected behavior is that pressing the Return key should trigger a 'Find' operation, which should be equivalent to clicking on the 'Find' button. The 'Find' button is highlighted as the 'default' button in the Find/Replace dialog.
EB: When using Eclipse 3.0 M2Build with Build ID 200307181617 on Mac OS X 10.2.6, the expected behavior is as follows: 1) Open the Find/Replace dialog by navigating to Edit -> Find/Replace. 2) Type a search term into the text box. 3) Press the Return key. The expected behavior is that pressing the Return key should trigger a 'Find' operation, which should be equivalent to clicking on the 'Find' button. The 'Find' button is highlighted as the 'default' button in the Find/Replace dialog.
SR: To reproduce this issue, please follow these steps: 1) Open Eclipse 3.0 M2Build with Build ID 200307181617 on Mac OS X 10.2.6. 2) Navigate to the 'Edit' menu and select 'Find/Replace.' 3) In the Find/Replace dialog, type a search term into the text box. 4) Press the Return key. Observe that nothing happens, which is not the expected behavior.
